lines.text:
[driviing his father into the trainyard]
Well, Dad, I got you here on time.
There's your pride and joy just coming off the turntable.

[talking to the engineer]
Yes, siree, Steve. I'll take her down.
Sure jealous of this old boiler, Dad.
Why shouldn't you be, my boy. She's part of me. Maybe I'm just part of her. I don't know. I took her out on her first run, and I hope L'll be at first throttle when I make my last,

[speaking of the fatal crash]
Who's ever back of it means my father was murdered, and I'll bring that man to justice if it takes the rest of my life.

[to the bad guys]
A fine chance of finding the gold with me dead!

[urging him to surrender the gold]
You're only making it worse.
Oh, nothing is worse than rotting in jail when you know you'e innocent,
